title: On-page SEO - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Bart van der Meer December 21, 2012 Website Creation from Scratch - The Step-by-step Guide to Optimize for SEO and UX On-page SEO Alright so you want to build a new website. And you want to make it as optimized for SEO and UX as possible before going live. In this guide I will take you through a step-by-step process on how to do that. Read this post By: Tom Harari December 7, 2012 How I Would Do SEO for Rap Genius On-page SEO A step-by-step approach to how Rap Genius can win the 'lyrics' SEO game and get ahead in a saturated market run by old dinosaurs. Read this post By: Matt Morgan November 19, 2012 Google SERP Test: Multiple Page Title & Meta Description Tags On-page SEO Have you ever wondered what would happen if you had multiple page title tags in the head of your webpage? How about multiple meta description tags? In this article, I am going to show you the results of my Google search experiment. Read this post By: Steven Macdonald August 29, 2012 Restructuring Your Website and How to Minimize Traffic Loss On-page SEO With a total of 21 websites in 15 languages, launching a new global web structure without losing a significant portion of traffic was always going to be a difficult task. Especially as more than 50% of total visits are from search engines. This blog post will show you two examples of how to launch a new website: Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard August 15, 2012 How Optimizing My Ugly Google+ Pic Increased Free Traffic 35% On-page SEO Over the years, SEOs have employed many techniques to control how their site appears in search results. These included: writing compelling Title Tags, descriptive Meta Descriptions, use of NOODP and NOYDIR meta tags, and keyword rich URLs. But times are changing. Read this post By: John Doherty July 30, 2012 Internal Linking Strategies for 2012 and Beyond On-page SEO A followup to last Friday's Whiteboard Friday, we clarify some of the points made with illustrations, mockups, and examples that show good vs risky examples of internal linking. The goal is to remain competitive, but to link in smart ways with varied anchor text. These strategies should keep you competitive while also looking towards the future and not worrying about over-optimizing your internal links, including links from your microsites or ccTLDs. Read this post By: Pallav Jain July 17, 2012 Let On-Page Optimization Change your Life! On-page SEO Do NOT underestimate the value of good content, on-page optimization, and strong theme building! As people involved in the SEO industry, we come across various websites in our scope of work. Ecommerce, lead-based information portals..the list is never ending! Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers June 28, 2012 Which Page is Canonical? On-page SEO Before you can remove duplicate content, you have to understand which URL is actually canonical. I provide five cases to show how the problem is more complicated than you might think. Read this post By: Ruth Burr Reedy June 20, 2012 Watch Out for Long Title Tags - An SEOmoz Case Study On-page SEO We've been seeing some strange new issues with title tags displaying in the SERPs lately. After a bit of sleuthing, here's what we found out: Read this post By: Joshua Bixby June 18, 2012 13 Questions (and Answers) About Google, Site Speed, and SEO On-page SEO It's been two years since Google announced that page speed is a factor in its search ranking, and one of the most-asked questions I still receive is: How exactly do they do it? The second-most-asked question I hear is: How much do I need to care about this? Read this post S By: Slavik Volinsky June 7, 2012 Responsive Web Design: The Ultimate Guide for Online Marketers On-page SEO As of February, the smartphone share in the United States has reached nearly 50%. 2012 is FINALLY "the year of mobile" and this means that you need to invest in a mobile user experience. Check your analytics — that mobile traffic share keeps growing! Read this post A By: Anna Slyter June 4, 2012 An Internal Link Juice Tool On-page SEO One of the challenges we have as an agency is working with clients who want to link to absolutely everything from their global navigation. A business owner or marketing manager often has a hard time deciding what is more and less important -- to them it's all important! This results in a bloated navigation that detracts from the SEO value that those internal links pass through t... Read this post By: Steven Macdonald May 24, 2012 SEO Basics that Helped Double Organic Traffic and Sales Overnight On-page SEO It's no secret that the world of SEO is moving towards the social arena. Google's latest round of algorithm updates in March sent clear signals of this and in their focus of Google+. But while many big brands still... Read this post By: Paddy Moogan April 29, 2012 Perfecting On-Page Optimization for Ecommerce Websites On-page SEO Back in 2009 (was it really that long ago?!) Rand wrote a post titled Perfecting Keyword Targeting and On-Page Optimization which is one of the most popular blog posts on SEOmoz. It is still referenced as much today as it was back in 2009. The core principles haven't changed that much, b... Read this post
